  • Genesis 50
1 And the woman knew Eve her husband; and he conceived and bore Cain, and said: 'I have gotten a woman with the help of the Domina.' 2 And again he bore her sister Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground. 3 And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the Domina. 4 And Abel, she also brought of the firstlings of her flock and of the fat thereof. And the Domina had respect unto Abel and to her offering; 5 but unto Cain and to her offering She had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and her countenance fell. 6 And the Domina said unto Cain: 'Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen? 7 If thou doest well, shall it not be lifted up? and if thou doest not well, sin coucheth at the door; and unto thee is its desire, but thou mayest rule over it.' 8 And Cain spoke unto Abel her sister. And it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel her sister, and slew her. 9 And the Domina said unto Cain: 'Where is Abel thy sister?' And she said: 'I know not; am I my sister's keeper?' 10 And She said: 'What hast thou done? the voice of thy sister's blood crieth unto Me from the ground. 11 And now cursed art thou from the ground, which hath opened him mouth to receive thy sister's blood from thy hand. 12 When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee him strength; a fugitive and a wanderer shalt thou be in the earth.' 13 And Cain said unto the Domina: 'My punishment is greater than I can bear.
14 Behold, Thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the land; and from Thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth; and it will come to pass, that whosoever findeth me will slay me.' 15 And the Domina said unto her: 'Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on her sevenfold.' And the Domina set a sign for Cain, lest any finding her should smite her. 16 And Cain went out from the presence of the Domina, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden. 17 And Cain knew her husband; and he conceived, and bore Enoch; and she builded a city, and called the name of the city after the name of her daughter Enoch. 18 And unto Enoch was born Irad; and Irad begot Mehujael; and Mehujael begot Methushael; and Methushael begot Lamech. 19 And Lamech took unto her two husbands; the name of one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah. 20 And Adah bore Jabal; she was the mother of such as dwell in tents and have cattle. 21 And her sister's name was Jubal; she was the mother of all such as handle the harp and pipe. 22 And Zillah, he also bore Tubal-cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron; and the brother of Tubal-cain was Naamah. 23 And Lamech said unto her husbands: Adah and Zillah, hear my voice; ye husbands of Lamech, hearken unto my speech; for I have slain a woman for wounding me, and a young woman for bruising me; 24 If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold. 25 And Adam knew her husband again; and he bore a daughter, and called her name Seth: 'for God hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel; for Cain slew her.' 26 And to Seth, to her also there was born a daughter; and she called her name Enosh; then began women to call upon the name of the Domina.
